instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Hi, I have this board from another shop. It is very clean. Nothing visually wrong with it as of now. Dont think it even had liquid damage. Without battery green light turns amber after a couple seconds. I dont know much more as of yet. Im getting this in now in case you see this so I have an idea what to look for in the morning. I do know I have all G3H, PP3V42, PP18VDCIN, PPVRTC (16.5V) and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. I also know Im missing S4 power.Possible SMC issue most likely because of amber light? Thank you, have a good
night/day.


Update 1 - Missing PP5V-S4. Missing <SIGNAL>P5V_S4_EN</SIGNAL>.

<CHIP>U7970</CHIP>

pn 6 - 3.3V
pn 2 - Low (0V)
pn 1 - (<SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL>) Missing.

<SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL> Diode mode - .667
L4901 3.4V


Udate 2 -

Tried reflow on SMC. No change.
Reballed SMC - No Change.


Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Just messing around without diagnosing anything?

First measure PPBUS and PPVRTC and report exact values here. Also inspect the common corrosion points on these, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and termination resistors. Check for power cycling on <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> preferably with a scope.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
the charger light is amber while charging battery or lacking one entirely by design on these.

Edit*** therefore... The orange light is arbitrary.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: No battery. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Sorry. To clarify... Someone correct me if I'm wrong, but these models have an orange light present whether there is a battery installed or not. The only time the light will hold solid green is WITH a battery when fully charged. The orange light alone the way you're describing isn't enough indicate the smc.

BTW what is the problem you're experiencing here anyway,? they need to understand what it is you're aiming to solve.



 Always deferred to the expert above- what voltages are present on the rails Duke requested.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Yeah... I just like re-balling shit...

Honestly I thought since I was missing <SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>P5V3V3_S4_EN</SIGNAL> that SMC would be possibility since thats where it comes from and i may as well try it. PPBUS is 12.56V and PPVRTC is fluctuates from 16.18 to 16.435V. I'm assuming you meant <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2650</CHIP>? <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>/50 both look good .99 to .107 on pin 8 <CHIP>U2650</CHIP>. No power cycling on <SIGNAL>P5V_S4</SIGNAL>. <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> looks good. <RESISTOR>R5021</RESISTOR> - 24Ohm, <RESISTOR>R5022</RESISTOR> - 43Ohm, <RESISTOR>R5023</RESISTOR> - 15Ohm <RESISTOR>R5024</RESISTOR> - 15Ohm.
Thanks Duke.

[USER="893"]2andrewd[/USER] -
Thank you. I didnt know that the orange light stays on with or without battery. Problem I am experiencing is no power/fan spin. Missing <SIGNAL>P5V_S4</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: If there really is 16v on PPVRTC this board is totally fried, check what you are measuring, should never be more than 3.4V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: Your right. Sorry I miss typed. That was PPDC-IN Didnt eat today. Get back to you with that. Thanks have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
PPBUSG3H - 12.56V
PP3V42 - 3.4V
PPVRTC is 3.33V
PPDCIN -  fluctuates 16.18 to 16.43V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - .001
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - MISSING
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.33V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 0.44
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - 0.004

PIN 8 <CHIP>U2650</CHIP>.  I plug in the charger and take measurement. At first it climbs to 0.110V then slowly drains to around -0.015V  then slowly start to climb again. Repeats this. How am I getting anything on <SIGNAL>3V3_S3</SIGNAL> without any other ones? 

Thanks Duke. Have a good day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Let's see if we can get all s5 rails before looking into FireWire/ether net. The reading on s3 is negligible.

Voltage on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: Hi. Thanks for response. I have 0V on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. Measured on pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R2805</RESISTOR>. Thanks again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: Did you come across any corrosion or tell tales?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: no. none at all. I wish. :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Voltage drop to ground  on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> in diode mode?

Voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF_L</SIGNAL>?

<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> termination resistors within spec? Traces between intact?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: I bet the machine is power cycling seeing the DCIN voltage is going up and down. Measure carefully on <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> preferably with a scope as a multimeter is too slow to catch the short pulses.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
Duke. I waited like 5 minutes on the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> with multi meter. stayed at .001. i dont have scope. If it is cycling and I cant catch it. Anything I can do. (besides buy a scope) :rolleyes:

Ill take your bet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: Thanks Duke and Andrew

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: Check the usual <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and termination resistors and traces to it. Shorts on all rails?

threads.message:
<CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>? Do you mean something else? I dont have in boardview or schematic.


<CHIP>U2600</CHIP>, <CHIP>U2650</CHIP>?


​​​​​​​Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
im going with 2600 & 2650


<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> in diode. .470

3.4V on <SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF_L</SIGNAL>

Termination resistors <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. Im assuming these are them.

<RESISTOR>R5120</RESISTOR> 43 OHM
<RESISTOR>R5121</RESISTOR> 43 OHM
<RESISTOR>R5122</RESISTOR> 43 OHM
<RESISTOR>R5123</RESISTOR> 24 OHM

<RESISTOR>R5110</RESISTOR> 15 OHM
<RESISTOR>R5111</RESISTOR> 15 OHM
<RESISTOR>R5112</RESISTOR> 15 OHM

pin 8 <CHIP>U2650</CHIP> .070V to -.009V (cycles)

When you say check for shorts on ALL rails Do you mean sub rails as well?

If Im wrong please correct me. Thank you for your time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: Try <CHIP>U7950</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> rather.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message:
ok. I have 3.3V on pin 8 of <CHIP>U7950</CHIP>.

<CHIP>U2600</CHIP>

pn 2 - 3.3V
pn 13 - 3.4V
pn 5 .002V
pn1 - 3.3V
pn 3 - goes from .022 to .001V
pn 4 - goes in the .320's .340'sV
pn 12 - .402V
pn 9 - 0V
pn8 - .259
pn15 - 0V
pin 11 - 0v
pin 6 - 0
pn 14 - climbs .058V

No scope. So I have no idea what frequencies are.

Hey.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amber light
threads.message: <SIGNAL>DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not ok. If <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is present then it could be a SMC or CPU/PCH issue.
